meanings.sent1: She laboured through the math problems, trying her best.
meanings.sent2: He laboured to finish the race, panting heavily.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel laboured comically to carry the oversized nut.
meanings.sent4: The old car laboured up the steep hill, groaning with effort.
meanings.sent5: The ant laboured tirelessly to move the large crumb to its nest.

meanings.definition: Showing signs of effort or strain
meanings.sent1: His laboured breathing indicated he had been running for a while.
meanings.sent2: The laboured expression on her face revealed her exhaustion.
meanings.sent3: The laboured attempt at a joke made everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The laboured pace of the turtle amused the onlookers.
meanings.sent5: The laboured movements of the robot made it seem almost human.

meanings.definition: To work hard or with difficulty
meanings.sent1: They laboured all day in the fields under the hot sun.
meanings.sent2: She laboured over her painting, adding intricate details.
meanings.sent3: The chef laboured over the perfect recipe, tasting and adjusting.
meanings.sent4: The writer laboured to find the right words for his novel.
meanings.sent5: The team laboured together to build the house before the storm.

meanings.sent1: The ship laboured through the rough waves of the storm.
meanings.sent2: He laboured up the mountain, determined to reach the summit.
meanings.sent3: The engine laboured as the car climbed the steep hill.
meanings.sent4: The runner laboured towards the finish line, pushing through the pain.
meanings.sent5: The ant laboured to carry the heavy leaf back to the colony.
